wikipedia_page.main: General surgeon Frederic Edward Manby, FRCS LRA JP (19 January 1845—1 July 1891), served as Mayor of Wolverhampton, 1888/89.

response: * Frederic Edward Manby  (1845–1891), surgeon and Mayor of Wolverhampton 1888/1889, elder brother to Alan Reeve Manby

Edward Manby was born on the 19th August 1864, the youngest son of Frederick Manby MD and his wife Catherine Reeve. Manby was born into a family of physicians in East Rudham, Norfolk, where both his father and his grandfather had practised. Along with two of his elder brothers, he attended Epsom College, founded in 1853 to provide a "liberal education" to 100 sons of "duly qualified medical men" for £25 each year. 145 pages His elder brother, Alan Reeve Manby, was Surgeon-Apothecary In Ordinary to the Prince of Wales at Sandringham and later Physician Extraordinary. His eldest sibling, Frederic Edward Manby was appointed Surgeon to the Wolverhampton and Staffordshire General Hospital and served as Mayor of Wolverhampton, 1888/89.
